meta.title: Complete Problem-Solving & Computational Thinking Masterclass for Kids
meta.description: Transform your child into a master problem solver! This 6-month comprehensive program teaches critical thinking, logical reasoning, and problem-solving through coding, puzzles, robotics, and real-world challenges. Perfect for ages 7-16, using tools like Scratch, Code.org, puzzles, and mind games.
meta.level: Complete Beginner to Advanced Problem Solver

program_overview.title: Complete Problem-Solving & Computational Thinking Masterclass
program_overview.tagline: Build a Problem-Solving Mindset That Lasts a Lifetime!
program_overview.description:
This transformative 6-month program doesn't just teach kids to code – it teaches them HOW TO THINK! Through engaging puzzles, coding challenges, real-world problems, and creative projects, students develop critical thinking skills that apply to every area of life.

Using a blend of coding platforms, logic puzzles, strategy games, and hands-on challenges, kids learn to break down complex problems, recognize patterns, develop algorithms, and create innovative solutions. Perfect for building confidence, improving academic performance, and preparing for future STEM careers.
what_makes_this_different: Focus on thinking skills, not just coding
Mix of digital and unplugged activities
Gamified learning with rewards and badges
Cross-curricular connections to math, science, and life

learning_path.phase_4: Mastery: Real-world challenges and creative solutions

phase_1_foundation.title: PHASE 1: Thinking Foundations (Months 1-2, Weeks 1-8)
phase_1_foundation.description: Build core thinking skills through puzzles, patterns, and logical reasoning. Start with unplugged activities and gradually introduce coding concepts.

week_1_2.title: Introduction to Problem Solving
topics: Understanding the problem (The 5 W's and How)
Breaking big problems into small pieces
Growth mindset: mistakes help us learn

week_3_4.title: Algorithmic Thinking Unplugged
projects: Create a board game with rules

week_13_14.title: Real-World Problem Solving
week_13_14.practice: Identify and solve one problem weekly

week_26.title: Final Capstone Project
projects: CAPSTONE: Solve a real community problem

phase_2_frontend_mastery.title: PHASE 2: Specialized Problem-Solving Tracks
phase_2_frontend_mastery.description: Choose specialized areas: Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, or Mathematics

phase_3_backend_engineering.title: ADVANCED TRACKS: Competitive & Specialized
phase_3_backend_engineering.description: Competition preparation and specialized problem-solving domains

phase_4_advanced_production.title: ENRICHMENT: Real-World Applications
phase_4_advanced_production.description: Apply problem-solving skills to real-world challenges and career exploration

week_104.title: Graduation & Beyond
week_104.assessment: CERTIFIED MASTER PROBLEM SOLVER - Ready to tackle any challenge!

projects_throughout_course: Month 1-2: 30+ logic puzzles, 20+ algorithms, 10+ pattern projects
additional_learning_resources.total_projects_built: 150+ projects ranging from puzzles to real-world solutions
skills_mastered: Computational Thinking: Decomposition, pattern recognition, abstraction, algorithms
Logic & Reasoning: Deductive, inductive, lateral thinking, critical analysis
Programming: Scratch, Python basics, block coding, algorithm implementation
Mathematics: Number theory, geometry, statistics, discrete math
Science: Scientific method, experimentation, data analysis, hypothesis testing
Engineering: Design process, prototyping, testing, iteration
Creativity: Innovation, ideation, design thinking, artistic expression
Collaboration: Teamwork, leadership, conflict resolution, project management
Research: Information gathering, analysis, synthesis, reporting
Technology: Apps, AI, IoT, robotics, web development basics

support_provided.community: Active community of young problem solvers
support_provided.resources: Extensive library of problems and solutions

who_is_this_for.students: Kids and teens wanting to develop critical thinking
who_is_this_for.kids: Any child wanting to think better
who_is_this_for.anyone: Anyone wanting to improve problem-solving skills
